definition: illegal immigration/to stowaway (on a ship)/to steal across the international border/to run a blockade

sentences.english: Claudia was eventually smuggled into the United States and taken to New York City.
sentences.chinese: 之後，克勞迪亞偷渡到美國，被送往紐約。

sentences.english: Drivers say migrants and people trafficking gangs have attacked their vehicles with metal bars.
sentences.chinese: 司機們稱難民和偷渡團伙用金屬桿襲擊過他們的車。

sentences.english: Secondly, actively develop the activities of anti-smuggling information campaign in various forms.
sentences.chinese: 以各種形式積極開展反偷渡宣傳活動。

sentences.english: Search methods, which are likely to harm secreted stowaways shall not be used.
sentences.chinese: 不得使用可能會對潛藏的偷渡者造成傷害的搜查辦法。

sentences.english: Fujian police arrested 242 human smugglers last year.
sentences.chinese: 福建警方去年共逮捕了偷渡蛇頭242名。

sentences.english: Most are fleeing conflicts in South Asia.
sentences.chinese: 大部分偷渡客是爲了逃離南亞的衝突。

sentences.english: Why don't they go back to where they went to?
sentences.chinese: 這些鬼佬爲什麼不回到他們偷渡過去的那個地方哪？

sentences.english: He is a white collar coyote. He also did money laundering.
sentences.chinese: 他是個專做白領偷渡的蛇頭，他也犯有洗錢罪。

sentences.english: In China, illegal immigrant endanger very deep, just like an epidemic.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，偷渡犯罪也像一場瘟疫，危害極深。

sentences.english: Boat capsize kills dozens of stowaways enroute to US.
sentences.chinese: 偷渡美國途中翻船，福建數十人喪生。

sentences.english: I got to know a lot of Algerian refugees and stowaways.
sentences.chinese: 我對阿爾及利亞難民和偷渡有了很多瞭解。

sentences.english: Jabba tasked his two competing henchmen to capture the elusive stowaway.
sentences.chinese: 賈巴命令兩個勾心鬥角的心腹去捉拿逃跑的偷渡者。

sentences.english: The group of stowaway crossed the border by greasing the palms of border guards.
sentences.chinese: 偷渡團伙買通邊防警衛，偷渡國境。

sentences.english: The group of stowaway crossed the border by greasing the palms of border guards.
sentences.chinese: 偷渡團伙買通邊防警衛，偷渡國境。

definition: to smuggle/to have an illicit affair
to cross a border (usually illegally)/to sneak in or out of a country
to repatriate (e.g. prisoners of war)/to send back
to embark/to travel by ship/to ferry
to leave a country or region/outbound (tourism)
to run away/to go into exile
to flee abroad/to run away/to desert/outflow
